qas.question: When Andreessen left the company he worked for, what new company did he start?
What browser did Andreessen release in 1994?
What did the World Wide Web help release in the 1990's?

plausible_answers.text: led to an explosion in web use

qas.question: What did the release of Mosaic in 1994 by NCSA lead to?
What company was started by Mosaic?
When was the NCSA Navigator released by Mosaic?
What percentage of web use did Mosaic have at its peak in 1993?

context: In <a1_0>1993<a1_0/>, browser software was further innovated by <a0_0>Marc Andreessen<a0_0/> with the release of <b4_0>Mosaic<b4_0/>, "the world's first popular browser", which made the World Wide Web system easy to use and more accessible to the average person. Andreesen's browser sparked the internet boom of the 1990s. The introduction of Mosaic in 1993 – one of the first graphical web browsers – <b5_0>led to an explosion in web use<b5_0/>. Andreessen, the leader of the Mosaic team at National Center for Supercomputing Applications (NCSA), soon started his own company, named <a2_0><b6_0>Netscape<b6_0/><a2_0/>, and released the Mosaic-influenced <a3_0>Netscape Navigator<a3_0/> in <b7_0>1994<b7_0/>, which quickly became the world's most popular browser, accounting for <b8_0>90%<b8_0/> of all web use at its peak (see usage share of web browsers).
